title: How to Make a Katniss Costume

steps.headline: Start with the top.
steps.description: Find a mint or light green or black collared blouse or polo shirt. It should be worn tucked into your pants. You can get a shirt like this from an online staff uniform supplier or from a thrift store. Alternatively, wear a black V-neck top.

steps.headline: Select some pants.
steps.description: For the pants, wear simple beige (light brown) trousers or cargo pants. Add a belt.

steps.headline: Add a jacket.
steps.description: Find a thin black hooded jacket that reaches your mid thighs if possible.

steps.headline: Choose suitable footwear.
steps.description: Ideally, you'll need some tall black boots. They cannot be heeled and are best with a rubber tread along the bottom, to make the boots look more athletic than stylish. Also, they should not have any embellishments other than a simple zipper up the side of the boot.

steps.headline: Find a copy of Katniss' signature Mockingjay pin.
steps.description: These are sold online, such as through online auction sellers. However, you could also make one by finding the design online, printing it off and attaching it to strong card. Use varnish suitable for paper to protect it from light rain (just in case) and hot glue a brooch pin to the back.

steps.headline: Arrange your hair suitably.
steps.description: If you already have brunette or black hair, you won't need a wig. However, if your hair is short, purchase a ponytail hair extension and braid it into your own hair. If you have a different color of hair, either wear a wig or use a temporary dye. Then, braid your hair in a diagonal Dutch Braid across the back of your head if you want an ideal Katniss look from the movie, but  if you want to go for an easier braid, just do a regular braid down your back (which is from the book). The Dutch Braid from the movie is most recognized, but either will give you a good Katniss look. Secure with a ponytail holder. Note that Katniss does have side bangs, so you could part your hair to one side to create a side bang type of look if necessary, but this step is optional. Use hairspray or gel to secure your hair. To add a wig if needed, tie your hair up and secure with a wig-cap first, then put on the wig.

steps.headline: Prepare your face and body makeup.
steps.description:
For a realistic portrayal of Katniss, some grime and blood would make excellent additions: Use black face paint to make random dirt and grime marks on your face, neck, arms, and legs. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":332,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":548.0769230769231,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use red face paint to make wounds on hands (burns), one cheek, neck, and one knee (tracker jackers), and if visible, streak on right calf (burn), also, if needed, coming from left ear (blast from destroying Careers' food). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508.4065934065934,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}

steps.headline: Add props.

tyn: Black t shirt or tank-top - not to long
Beige or dark brown, solid-khaki pants or capris (preferably no pockets)
Long, black jacket with hood, 2 small slit pockets if possible, zipper
Dark brown belt, most likely with black buckle, 2-3 inches (5-7.5cm) in width (optional)
Earth-coloured (i.e, dark green, brown, black) rain boots, or low-cut hiking boots
Straight, black or dark, long hair (braided), wig perhaps (optional)
Mockingjay pin (or other gold, circular pin) (can be found on eBay, bookstores, or Hot Topic, or make your own)
Imitation bow and arrow (can be found at a dollar store, or see Related wikiHows for instructions)
A bright orange backpack or district 12 backpack (from feast)
Red and black face and/or body paint (optional)
text:
Start with the top. Find a mint or light green or black collared blouse or polo shirt. It should be worn tucked into your pants. You can get a shirt like this from an online staff uniform supplier or from a thrift store. Alternatively, wear a black V-neck top. Select some pants. For the pants, wear simple beige (light brown) trousers or cargo pants. Add a belt. Add a jacket. Find a thin black hooded jacket that reaches your mid thighs if possible. Choose suitable footwear. Ideally, you'll need some tall black boots. They cannot be heeled and are best with a rubber tread along the bottom, to make the boots look more athletic than stylish. Also, they should not have any embellishments other than a simple zipper up the side of the boot. Find a copy of Katniss' signature Mockingjay pin. These are sold online, such as through online auction sellers. However, you could also make one by finding the design online, printing it off and attaching it to strong card. Use varnish suitable for paper to protect it from light rain (just in case) and hot glue a brooch pin to the back. Arrange your hair suitably. If you already have brunette or black hair, you won't need a wig. However, if your hair is short, purchase a ponytail hair extension and braid it into your own hair. If you have a different color of hair, either wear a wig or use a temporary dye. Then, braid your hair in a diagonal Dutch Braid across the back of your head if you want an ideal Katniss look from the movie, but if you want to go for an easier braid, just do a regular braid down your back (which is from the book). The Dutch Braid from the movie is most recognized, but either will give you a good Katniss look. Secure with a ponytail holder. Note that Katniss does have side bangs, so you could part your hair to one side to create a side bang type of look if necessary, but this step is optional. Use hairspray or gel to secure your hair. To add a wig if needed, tie your hair up and secure with a wig-cap first, then put on the wig. Prepare your face and body makeup. For a realistic portrayal of Katniss, some grime and blood would make excellent additions: Use black face paint to make random dirt and grime marks on your face, neck, arms, and legs. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":332,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":548.0769230769231,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use red face paint to make wounds on hands (burns), one cheek, neck, and one knee (tracker jackers), and if visible, streak on right calf (burn), also, if needed, coming from left ear (blast from destroying Careers' food). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-7Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":308,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":508.4065934065934,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Add props. A few key props will help to finalize the whole Katniss image. Some suggestions include: Make a bow and arrow. Carry this around or sling it over your back or shoulder. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":315,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":519.8901098901099,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Alternatively, hold a cardboard/fake plastic knife. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":307,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":507.3626373626374,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Secure a mud-covered neon orange backpack on your shoulders. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Katniss-Costume-Step-8Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":323,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":533.4615384615385,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Finished.
sentences: Start with the top.
Find a mint or light green or black collared blouse or polo shirt.
It should be worn tucked into your pants.
You can get a shirt like this from an online staff uniform supplier or from a thrift store.
Alternatively, wear a black V-neck top.
Select some pants.
For the pants, wear simple beige (light brown) trousers or cargo pants.
Add a belt.
Add a jacket.
Find a thin black hooded jacket that reaches your mid thighs if possible.
Choose suitable footwear.
Ideally, you'll need some tall black boots.
They cannot be heeled and are best with a rubber tread along the bottom, to make the boots look more athletic than stylish.
Also, they should not have any embellishments other than a simple zipper up the side of the boot.
Find a copy of Katniss' signature Mockingjay pin.
These are sold online, such as through online auction sellers.
However, you could also make one by finding the design online, printing it off and attaching it to strong card.
Use varnish suitable for paper to protect it from light rain (just in case) and hot glue a brooch pin to the back.
Arrange your hair suitably.
If you already have brunette or black hair, you won't need a wig.
However, if your hair is short, purchase a ponytail hair extension and braid it into your own hair.
If you have a different color of hair, either wear a wig or use a temporary dye.

Then, braid your hair in a diagonal Dutch Braid across the back of your head if you want an ideal Katniss look from the movie, but  if you want to go for an easier braid, just do a regular braid down your back (which is from the book).
The Dutch Braid from the movie is most recognized, but either will give you a good Katniss look.
Secure with a ponytail holder.
Note that Katniss does have side bangs, so you could part your hair to one side to create a side bang type of look if necessary, but this step is optional.
Use hairspray or gel to secure your hair.
To add a wig if needed, tie your hair up and secure with a wig-cap first, then put on the wig.
Prepare your face and body makeup.

For a realistic portrayal of Katniss, some grime and blood would make excellent additions:
Use black face paint to make random dirt and grime marks on your face, neck, arms, and legs.

Some suggestions include:
